intro: Copiapoa echinata, commonly known as the Pariña cactus, is a species of cactus native to the Atacama Desert in Chile. It is a columnar cactus with a distinctive rib structure and spines that vary in color from white to reddish-brown. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring. It is adapted to survive in arid conditions with minimal water requirements. Its slow growth rate and unique appearance make it a popular choice for collectors and desert gardeners.
